title: Like the Queen, I don't give a monkey's for elocution lessons
text:
Interviewing Christopher Biggins in The Ivy, he told me that one thing changed his life. Dear old Auntie Vi sent the young Biggins off for elocution lessons and the rest, as they say, is history. As Biggins munched on kangaroo testicles while becoming King of the Jungle back in 2007, his vowels remained as polished as ever.

So many people I’ve met have told me that elocution was the single-biggest turning point in their lives. Not one of them has said they wished they kept the old accent.

But I’m from Northolt and I’ve still got my Northolt accent, although it’s a close-run thing. A teacher urged my parents to send me for elocution lessons. They either couldn’t see the point, or realised that...
